p:
The rate of pediatric MERS‐CoV infection is relatively low in comparison to adults.
23 A large Saudi Arabian study that screened for MERS‐CoV by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) testing in a selected at‐risk population, including 8032 children (<14 years old) found 0.1% who tested positive when compared with 0.7% in adults.
25 The most common source of infection was household contact and acquired infection within a healthcare facility.
